# Data Comparison Project

This project compares Alivedata Core with other data sources using modern Python data analysis tools.

## Project Structure
- Poetry for dependency management
- DuckDB for analytical database operations
- Modern visualization stack (matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, bokeh)
- Data processing with pandas, polars, and fireducks
- Code quality tools (ruff, black)

## Key Components
- `/src/data/` - ETL operations
- `/src/models/` - Model training and prediction
- `/src/visualization/` - Plotting utilities
- `/config/` - DuckDB and project settings
- `/notebooks/` - Jupyter analysis notebooks

## Dependencies
Main packages: dabbler, pandas, polars, fireducks, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, bokeh, datashader, duckdb, dataprofiler, pydantic, loguru, weasyprint, black, ruff

## Database Configuration
Uses DuckDB with 50GB memory limit, 6 threads, spatial and ICU extensions enabled.
Database file: `data/processed/data_comparison.duckdb`

## Development Workflow
1. Poetry for environment management
2. Git for version control (shell for init, VSCode for daily use)
3. Jupyter Lab for interactive analysis
4. pytest for testing
